feed.title: SAP Community - SAP Business One
feed.subtitle: SAP Business One Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: SAP B1 10.0 - SBO Mailer stop working for Gmail (from 1st May 25)
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We are using SAP 10.0 SBO mailer. But our SBO mailer is not working for Gmail as  less secure apps are no longer support by Google from 1st May 25. So Basic Authentication functionality is not working.

Any way to configured Gmail account for SBO mailer. Please advice.

entry.title: user-defined fields blocked/read only SAP BO Purchase Order Window
entry.content:
Hi,

I have a user who has the Financial Limited license, who has access to the Purchase Order window. He is able to query any PO with the PO number, using the Find (binocular) button. The problem is that he is the only user who cannot use this Find button to query with User-Defined fields values. These fields appears blocked, like read-only fields. I "Restore Default" the window, putting back all user-defined fields to the original position, and put them back. Same thing. Attached the Purchase Order Windows for you to see the problem. I have searched for a solution with no solution available, I have no idea how to solve it, I appreciate your help and your time.

Thanks!

entry.title: UDT creation fails in SBODemoAU database
entry.content:
Hi,

We have a program which creates a number of UDTs and UDFs inside a demo DB (SBODemoUS). This uses inTransaction before the start of the process so that if any error happens in between the whole process can be rolled back.This works fine with SBODemoUS DB. But this process fails in SBODemoAU, SBODemoDE databases when we tested. There is no error getting logged. The SAP B1 UI getting non responsive. And this is not happening at a particular point in execution of code.it is random at different fields creation. How can we troubleshoot this? Is there any settings to be checked with these two databases?

Thanks,

Deepesh

entry.title: Web Dispatcher getting Application Quits Error while working
entry.content:
Hi

In SAP B1 10.280 on Windows + HANA 2.0 with BAS Gatekeeper Environment, users getting "application quits" error time to time while they are working on web dispatcher.  there's no issue with network connectivity like overload. When get the error user need to refresh the web browser to continue the work, can someone help to resolve the issue ?

entry.title: FMS In Good Issue
entry.content:
HI experts ,

I am implementing FMS in Good Issue to change  Account code based on Department cost center selected by user.This is my current Query,it works.but what happens is when i select the department,the account code gets updated,but the department is left blank.I have to again select the department.how can I achieve sth like whenever i change department code,the account code should be changed and department should be reflected rather than me having to select department again.I have attached my FMS set up as well.

SELECT
CASE
WHEN IFNULL($[$13.10001010.0], '') = 'IDC-1027' THEN '5001014'
WHEN IFNULL($[$13.10001010.0], '') = 'IDC-1028' THEN '5001015'
ELSE '100017' -- default account if blank or any other value
END
FROM DUMMY

entry.title: Unable to find "Name positioning" Field for Employee Master DTW Template
entry.content:
Hi,

I am unable to find "Name positioning" Field for Employee Master DTW Template. 
I am using - SAP Business One 10.0 version for SAP HANA (10.00.270) SP 2411 (64-bit)
Thank You in advance.



Regards,
Satinath

entry.title: Is there any auto save option feature in SAP Business One for Marketing Documents ?
entry.content:
Hi Community,

I want to know whether in SAP B1, we have an option to auto save our marketing documents ?

entry.title: SAP B1 - FA - specified useful life causes remaining life to become zero or -ve, re-enter usefullife
entry.content:
SAP Business One v10 - Fixed Asset module:

The following are the sequence of the event:

  1. When asset taken in on 3 Jul 2025, it has 60 months useful life

  2. useful life changed from 60 to 120 on 3 Jul 2025

  3. useful life changed from 120 to 62 on 22 Aug 2025

  4. useful life changed from 62 to 80 on 22 Aug 2025

5. Now  want to change useful life from 80 to 60, and system prompts error ‘specified useful life causes remaining life to become zero or negative, re-enter useful life'. Look like system doesn’t allow it.

Any idea? It is system behavior that doesn't allow such sequence of changes for useful life?

      "WithholdingTaxLines": []
    }
  ]
}

All the batch numbers are awailable.

Document lines without batches are not batched.

ServiceLayer returns following error: Cannot add row without complete selection of batch/serial numbers.

When I change the request to contain only single batched item, it works, the request is successfull.

Adding multiple batched items in one request fails. 

Is there something wrong with my request or is it a ServiceLayer bug?

entry.title: Error CRToWords.DLL” and “Load report failed” during PDF Generation in SAP B1 HANA Add-On
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We are currently using SAP Business One 10.0 (HANA) and have developed a custom add-on to send emails to customers with the corresponding Invoice PDF attached.

As part of the process, we are converting a Crystal Report (.rpt) file to PDF using a PDF generator executable, and then sending the output via email. This works as expected on our Windows Server and several local machines.

However, on multiple user systems, we are encountering the following error during PDF conversion:

ExportToPdf Cannot find "CRToWords.DLL".
Error in File C:\Users\Intern\AppData\Local\Temp\AR {E93D4A7D-C4DF-4770-BBD8-A77207E508F2}.rpt:
Error in formula <Amt in Wds>.
Cannot find "CRToWords_??.DLL".

Additional Context:

  • The report includes a formula to convert the invoice amount into words, which uses a UFL (User Function Library).

  • If we suppress this formula, the PDF conversion works. But this logic is business-critical and cannot be removed.

  • The issue occurs only on specific client machines, not all systems.

    Even after removing the formula (for testing), we now see this error on the same machines:

    01/09/2025 5:19:12 PM : connstring
    01/09/2025 5:19:12 PM : Starting
    01/09/2025 5:19:12 PM : strfn Y:\invoices\AMT_INV_278315.pdf
    01/09/2025 5:19:12 PM : RPTPath 'Y:\RPT\AR.rpt'
    01/09/2025 5:19:12 PM : ExportToPdf: Load report failed.

entry.title: Creating QR codes in B1 HANA
entry.content:
Dear experts,

As per note 3066813, we are trying to implement creation of QR codes via stored procedure in HANA. However, we are having a problem with defining the parameters. The note states that parameters need to be defined with @ sign:

CREATE PROCEDURE [dbo].[TmSp_QRCodeSPGenerated_PT_13] @DocKey@ INT, @ObjectId@ INT

 

But when we adjust this for HANA as stated below, we get an error (probably because of the @ sign). So, how to use this functionality in HANA?

CREATE PROCEDURE "TmSp_QRCodeSPGenerated_XX_13" ("@DocKey@" INT, "@ObjectId@" INT)

entry.title: Issue in SAP B1: add-on disabled, blocking invoice sending for some users only. Cause?
entry.content:
Hello,
I experienced an issue in SAP Business One, within the Extension Manager: one of the add-ons was disabled, which prevented invoice submissions from being processed. What is peculiar is that this situation did not occur for all users, but only for some of them.

Could you please let me know what might have caused the add-on to be disabled and why the problem only affected certain users and not all?

entry.title: Integration Framework 2.0 HTTA Adapter Issue
entry.content:
This is an integration between SAP and Salesforce using OAuth2.

I have a problem with the HTTA adapter in IntegrationFramework 2.0. I need to do the following:
When a business partner is added in SAP,  my scenario should be triggered, where I first log in to obtain a Bearer token, and then use the obtained token to send data about the new business partner to the provided endpoint.

The input in HTTA Adapter is:

The problem is that I cannot get the token at all. The integration process ends with the message "Bad request":

Has anyone experienced a similar problem, and do you have a solution for the issue described above?

Thank you in advance.

entry.title: SAP B1: Formatted Search auto-trigger on header UDF does not fire (manual run works)
entry.content:
Environment:
  • SAP Business One [version 10.0/ 10.00.201]: on SQL Server
  • Client: 64-bit [FP 2208]
  • Document: Goods Receipt PO (OPDN)
  • All fields used below are header-level UDFs
Goal

Populate UDF U_mbl (MBL number) automatically from UDF U_billOfLanding when the user changes U_billOfLanding.
Additionally, only accept the value if the first 4 characters match a carrier code stored in UDT [@CTX_CARRIER].

UDFs
  • U_billOfLanding (NVARCHAR(50), header)
  • U_mbl (NVARCHAR(50), header)
Saved Query (works when executed manually)
-- CopyMBLausBL (SQL Server)
DECLARE @v NVARCHAR(50) =
  REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE(REPLACE($[$U_billOfLanding.0.0], CHAR(9), ''), CHAR(10), ''), CHAR(13), ''), ' ', '');

SELECT CASE 
         WHEN EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM [@CTX_CARRIER] T0 WHERE T0.Code = LEFT(@v, 4))
         THEN @v
         ELSE ''
       END;

(The query returns exactly one scalar value. Example input “MEDUK 4923174” → sanitized to “MEDUK4923174”.)

FMS Setup on U_mbl
  • Search in User-Defined Values by Saved Query → CopyMBLausBL
  • Auto Refresh When Field Changes → Trigger Bill of Lading (U_billOfLanding, header UDF)
  • Also tried: different trigger field (another header UDF), and Regularly Update
Expected vs. Actual
  • Expected: After editing U_billOfLanding and leaving the field, U_mbl should be filled by the query result.
  • Actual: Nothing happens.
    If I click the magnifier on U_mbl, the query executes and the field is populated correctly. “Regularly update” also makes no difference.
Reproduction Steps
  1. Open a GRPO (OPDN) in Add/Update mode.
  2. Enter a value in U_billOfLanding (e.g., MEDUK 4923174) and tab out.
  3. Observe U_mbl: no change.
  4. Click the magnifier (Formatted Search) on U_mbl: field is filled as expected.
Troubleshooting Done
  • Recreated the FMS mapping from scratch.
  • Verified the trigger points to the header UDF (System Information shows U_billOfLanding).
  • Tried an extremely simple query on U_mbl:
SELECT $[$U_billOfLanding.0.0]  -- mirror test

and even:

SELECT 'PING'

 

→ Auto-trigger still does not write.

  • Tried an alternative trigger field (another header UDF) → same behavior.
  • Set Regularly Update (for testing) → still no update.
  • UDF lengths are sufficient (50 chars), data types NVARCHAR; query returns exactly one value.
Questions for the community
  1. Are there known issues with header-level FMS auto-refresh on OPDN in [my version/FP]?
  2. Does the target UDF need to be on the standard UDF side panel for the FMS trigger to fire (vs. embedded on the main form via Screen Painter/Add-on)?
  3. Could an Add-on (e.g., Coresuite or others) intercept UI/Validate events and prevent FMS auto-execution, even though manual execution still works?
  4. Any additional settings/logging I can enable to diagnose why Auto Refresh When Field Changes isn’t firing?
  5. Is there a recommended workaround (besides scripting) to make header-UDF→header-UDF FMS triggers reliable?
Notes
  • Manually running the saved query always returns the correct value.
  • The issue appears to be the auto-trigger, not the SQL.
Attachments
  • Screenshot of FMS setup dialog showing the saved query and trigger field (attached).

entry.title: How can I retrieve through the Service Layer the quantity of items per batch in each warehouse?
entry.content:
Currently, I can only see the available batches and the total quantity of items per warehouse, but not the distribution of quantities per warehouse for each batch.

I have already tested the available endpoints and was not able to combine the information of batches with the available quantity per batch. Is there any path or call in the Service Layer that provides this information?

entry.title: service item in US localization sap b1
entry.content:
Hello,

I am trying to create a non stock item as a service item in SAP B1 for US localization and it is not available. anyone knows if this is a restriction for US localization? can I sell an item without inventory if service item cannot be created? we dont want to use the G/L code option, we want to use items to sell services.

 

thank you!

entry.title: Blocked Sales Order
entry.content:
Dear SAP Team,

A. Block Edit Quantity Sales Order
Customer Expectations related to Sales Order:
1. Create new sales order
2. There is an Approval Process
3. Add Sales Order
4. Edit Sales Order Quantity
5. There is a Blocking Notif [B]Can't Edit Quantity!

Reality after Blocking:
1. Create new sales order
2. There is an Approval Process
3. Add Sales Order
4. Edit Sales Order Quantity
5. There must be re-approval
6. Approved Sales Order
7. User Update Sales Order and there is a Blocking Notif [B]Can't Edit Quantity!

B. Reality Data
Block created

IF (:transaction_type = 'U') AND (:object_type = '17')

THEN

      SELECT COUNT(*) into myrowid

      FROM ORDR T0

      INNER JOIN RDR1 T1 ON T0."DocEntry" = T1."DocEntry"

      WHERE T0."DocEntry"  = :list_of_cols_val_tab_del AND T1."Quantity" <>(select a."Quantity" from ADO1 a

      where a."DocEntry" = T1."DocEntry" and a."LineNum" = T1."LineNum" and a."ObjType" = T1."ObjType"

      and a."LogInstanc" = (select Max(a."LogInstanc")from ADOC a where a."DocEntry" = :list_of_cols_val_tab_del and a."ObjType" = '17'))

      ;

      IF(:myrowid>0)

            THEN error := :error +1;

                  error_message := '[B]Tidak Bisa Edit Quantity!' ;

            END IF;

            END IF;

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1COTIDRkCSCemutGvj0DFO5G-qwrgPUfB/edit

So, how do we meet the customer's expectations regarding the Sales Order?

Thank You

entry.title: ways to access the user logs?
entry.content: Other than "Access Log" and "Change Log" is/are there any other ways I can access the user logs?
